availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Thomas P. Hill (Lincoln County, Kentucky, attorney)

body.p: Lincoln County, Kentucky, attorney. Pulaski County, Kentucky, native. Son of Thomas O. Hill. Married to Maria A. Peyton Hill. Father of Zuritha L. Hill, Mary "Mollie" Hill, Anna M. Hill, Alfred A. Hill, Thomas P. Hill, and W. Bailey Hill. Educated at St. Mary's College in Marion, Kentucky. Studied law under John Kincaid. Attorney in Wayne County in 1850. Admitted to the bar in 1852. Law partners with J. W. Alcorn. Attorney in Lincoln County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Wayne County, Division No. 1, p. 289B
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Lincoln County, p. 16
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Lincoln County, Stanford, p. 96B
H. Levin, The Lawyers and Lawmakers of Kentucky (Chicago: The Lewis Publishing Company, 1897), 539-40.
Find A Grave_, "Thomas Pinckney Hill (1826-1908)," Memorial #41316140, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/41316140 (accessed July 2, 2019).
